NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Road and Capacity or the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Cost?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Last Mile} and {Cost} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Tracking and Safety or the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Tracking} and {Safety} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Pipeline and Efficiency or the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Speed?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Pipeline} and {Efficiency} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Last Mile and Labor or the cell corresponding to Pipeline and Reliability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Pipeline} and {Reliability} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.81 to 0.87?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Road, Capacity), (Intermodal, Compliance), (Intermodal, Cost), (Road, Labor), (Last Mile, Reliability), (Maritime, Reliability), (Rail, Reliability)}.
